name: A. Slime Combining
statement:
Your friend recently gave you some slimes for your birthday. You have
slimes all initially with value .You are going to play a game with these
slimes. Initially, you put a single slime by itself in a row. Then, you
will add the other slimes one by one. When you add a slime, you place it
at the right of all already placed slimes. Then, while the last two
slimes in the row have the same value , you combine them together to
create a slime with value .You would like to see what the final state of
the row is after youâ€™ve added all slimes. Please print the values of the
slimes in the row from left to right.
editorial:
We can simulate the process described in the problem statement. There
are many possible implementations of this, so see the example code for
one possible implementation. This method can take O(n) time. However,
there is a faster method. It can be shown that the answer is simply the
1-based indices of the one bits in the binary representation of . So, we
can just do this in O(log n) time. Example code (for simulation):
http://codeforces.com/contest/618/submission/15669470 Example code (for
faster method): http://codeforces.com/contest/618/submission/15669458
